*Genre:* Psychological Thriller / Crime and Drama 
 Scene 1: Courtroom - Custody Battle 
*The courtroom is tense. Harsh Beniwal (36, sharp features, dark circles) sits stiffly, fists clenched. Shweta (34, poised but exhausted) avoids his gaze. Their kids‚ÄîArnav (12) and Anaya (9)‚Äîare absent. The judge slams the gavel.* 
*Judge:* "After reviewing the evidence, custody of Arnav and Anaya Beniwal is granted to the mother, Shweta Beniwal. Mr. Harsh Beniwal gets visitation rights: one supervised visit per month." 
*Harsh‚Äôs face crumples. He stares at Shweta, eyes pleading.* 
*Harsh (whispering, voice raw):** "Shweta... please. Bachchon ko mat chhino. Unke bina main...
*Shweta doesn‚Äôt react, her expression icy. She stands, adjusts her saree, and walks out. Harsh slumps, tears streaming. His lawyer pats his shoulder, but Harsh shoves him away.* 
*Harsh (muttering):* "Meri galti thi... par bachche? Unki kya galti? 
Emotions:-
Harsh: Devastation, guilt. He doesn‚Äôt care about losing Shweta‚Äîit‚Äôs the kids‚Äô absence that shatters him. 
- *Shweta:* Cold relief. She won but shows no triumph, only exhaustion. 
--- 
Scene 2: Bar - Same Night 
*Harsh drowns his sorrows in a dimly lit bar. Whiskey glasses litter the table. He stares at his phone wallpaper‚ÄîArnav and Anaya laughing.* 
*Bartender:*"Sir, last call. You‚Äôve had enough." 
*Harsh (slurring):*"Enough? Nahin... kabhi nahin. Mere bachchon ko dekho... unki aawaz suno. *He plays a voicemail:* 
*Anaya (voice):*"Papa, when are you coming? I drew a dinosaur for you!" 
*Harsh sobs, slamming his fist on the bar.* 
*Harsh:*"Usne mujhe sirf ek mahine mein ek baar milne diya... ek baar! 
*Emotions:* 
- *Harsh:* Anguished, self-loathing. His grief isn‚Äôt for the marriage‚Äîit‚Äôs the kids. Alcohol fuels his despair. 
--- 
 Scene 3: Shweta‚Äôs Apartment - 1 Month Later 
*Harsh arrives with gifts‚ÄîArnav‚Äôs favorite cricket bat, Anaya‚Äôs art set. Shweta blocks the door.* 
*Shweta:*"Aaj nahin, Harsh. Arnav ka exam hai kal.
*Harsh:*"Par humne decide kiya tha‚Äîek baar mahine mein! _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

Happy Birthday, Abhishek!
Your jokes have been a real comfort- they
didn't just make me laugh- they patched
up parts of me I didn't even know were
broken. I've watched your reels on loop so
many times, I know them word for word,
but they still hit just as hard.
Now I don't even need a punchline-just
hearing your name makes me smile. You
probably have no idea how much you help
people just by being you.
Tons of love and best wishes,üå∏üå∏ @aupmanyu ‚ú®Ô∏è

topComment.text:
I am writing to express my extreme disappointment with my very first order from Beast Life. My order (ID: ******277DN) was supposed to be delivered by 14th August. I even made it a prepaid order expecting it to be treated with priority.

However, despite multiple follow-ups, the product has been stuck at the destination hub for the past 6 days with no further updates. Each time I call customer support, I first wait 7‚Äì8 minutes before being connected to an agent, only to hear the same response: ‚ÄúWe are escalating the issue.‚Äù But no action has been taken.

This experience has been highly frustrating and unprofessional. I regret choosing Beast Life and will make sure to share this negative experience with others, including my gym community, to ensure they are aware of the poor service.

I expect an immediate resolution and a clear update on when my product will actually be delivered.

sponsored_posts.topic: Muft ka chandan, ghis mere nandan ü•∞ #PerplexityProOnAirtel #ad

topComment.text:
Hi @airtelindia Hi,

I visited walk-in store at 

Shop No 3, Santoshi Darshan Apartment, near Santoshi Mata Mandir, opposite Central Bank Of India, Vijay Nagar, Kalyan East, Kalyan, Maharashtra 421306

When I started my postpaid plan in June they said me you would need to be active on postpaid for three months then after three months we can shift to prepaid.

Now when I visited the store every executive was giving me different answers, some said 90 days other said 120 days

I am not happy with the service, the executive themselves have no accurate answer and information about the services they are offering.

Everything on social media and paper looks good but when we visit store reality is something else and intolerant on how the executive speaks and shares different information for the same question.

My concern are when I bought the postpaid connection I was informed use three months we can switch it after three months.

Bought connection in June and September will be my third month still the executive denied and said you will need to be active until December.

Pathetic to see such information.

Executive said 120 days but when they checked the system they were like December is when you should visit us again.

organic_posts.topic: Hire me Heathrow

topComment.text: After traveling through multiple international airports‚Äîespecially Madrid and Frankfurt‚ÄîI agree that some of the experiences mentioned here are true. However, I have found the staff at Heathrow Airport to be very helpful. On one occasion, a staff member even skipped their lunch break to help me and my family get our next boarding passes printed and assist us quickly to the gates, as the passes we received from the initial airport had incorrect boarding times. Overall, I find the staff at Heathrow to be friendly and supportive, and as a family, we now prefer to fly through Heathrow.

topComment.text: After traveling through multiple international airports‚Äîespecially Madrid and Frankfurt‚ÄîI agree that some of the experiences mentioned here are true. However, I have found the staff at Heathrow Airport to be very helpful. On one occasion, a staff member even skipped their lunch break to help me and my family get our next boarding passes printed and assist us quickly to the gates, as the passes we received from the initial airport had incorrect boarding times. Overall, I find the staff at Heathrow to be friendly and supportive, and as a family, we now prefer to fly through Heathrow.
